title: Is there a way to make server changes in studio while playtesting?

posts.content_html:
Going back and forth from client to server while playtesting is tedious. Is there a shortcut or a different playtest option? I could have sworn there was a studio feature like this some years back that allowed you to edit the server while in solo play

Edit: People are saying they’re confused. Im wondering if there is a test type that allows the changes I make to save without having to toggle between server and client.

i don’t think i understand your question

you can interact with the explorer while playtesting, but your changes won’t save

You can edit the server by clicking on the computer icon on the top bar, although your changes will get removed once you end the play test .

If you are referring to starting on the server, you can change the play test context to Run.
In the Test menu there is that toggle view option.. Not sure if that’s what you’re talking about.
Yea, I was asking if there is a shortcut to toggle client & server or if I could interact so that the changes save
You can do something then copy it while testing, then paste that back when done..
you’re able to set a shortcut for toggling server and client view (just go to shortcut customization and search it). your changes still won’t save after simulation though.
